explanation: No additional symbols are required. MHD_SHA512_256_init has an empty callee set in the provided static call graph (it does not call any functions). MISRA’s prohibition on a function calling itself (directly or indirectly) requires a call-path that starts at the function and eventually returns to it. Because MHD_SHA512_256_init has no outgoing calls, no such path can exist; callers (digest_init_one_time, digest_reset) cannot create an A->...->A cycle unless A calls out to other functions, which it does not. Therefore, based on the provided static call graph, no other symbols are needed to conclude that MHD_SHA512_256_init does not violate the rule. (If there were indirect call mechanisms not represented in the static graph — e.g. function pointers, callbacks, or macro-generated calls — those target symbols would need to be inspected, but none are indicated in the given graph.)
